TopicTitle: ksp1 discussion still showing blank page on Firefox

Articles.Content:
Chrome I see the threads, Firefox (my weapon of choice) its blank. Mobile, desktop doesnt matter. Other forums appear as expected.

This has been an issue since the preKSP2 launch update. Clearing cache does not change it.
Hmm. Some of our moderators use Firefox and are not having trouble. Anyone else?
Have them log in as mere mortals perhapes?

On 3/10/2023 at 11:58 PM, tg626 said:

Have them log in as mere mortals perhapes?

Still borked?   Working fine me, regardless of login status.
Yes. However while deleting the cache to make sure that wasn't it, I discovered I can see the content if I'm not logged in...

2 hours ago, tg626 said:

Yes. However while deleting the cache to make sure that wasn't it, I discovered I can see the content if I'm not logged in...

Random spitball idea: whitelist forums.kerbalspacwprogram.com in whatever Adblocker or antivirus you’re using  with Firefox.

I'm not, it's just FF and why would it affect that ONE forum alone? OTOH why would one one forum have an issue with only one browser?

I do know that there were others that did the same thing immediately after the reorganizing.

After a few days and at least one additional outtage where the CSS wasn't loading from amazonaws, those others started working.

RESOLUTION:

I dont know what Firfox damage is, but nothing was working. Delete cache, delete browsing data, turn off all tracking protections, slap my nextdoor neighbor... Nothing worked.

While working on a website of my own, I discovered that cached files were in use EVEN IF I CLEARED THE CACHE and by that I mean both inside Firefox and thru Android's App Manager.

The only workaround was incogneto browsing.

Sure enough, logging in while incogneto I could see the page. Logging in regular browsing I got a blank page.

Finally I cleared site data and cookies, cleared all browsing data, deleted app cache in Android, uninstalled Firefox, appologized to my neighbor, and rebooted my phone.

Reinstalled FireFlake and lo and behold, it now works.

Edited March 15, 2023 by tg626

9 hours ago, tg626 said:

slap my nextdoor neighbor.

Ohhh!   There’s your problem!   You needed to slap the neighbor across the street, and buy ice cream for the next door neighbor.    Common mistake.  
 

Glad it’s fixed.
